entry.title: RISE
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 60.00 - 95.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

Finca El Platanar y Anexos is a family company whose members are fully committed to producing coffee of the highest quality and excellence, seeking a balance between productivity and sustainability of the environment in which it is grown. Its Owners are constantly seeking new technologies and farming techniques that benefit the productivity of plantations, without losing sight of the organoleptic characteristics of the harvested grains.

All harvested coffee at Finca El Platanar y Anexos, involves a well-defined ripe fruit selection, making at the end of the day a thorough cleaning, to avoid sending immature cherries to the wet milling process.

CypherED Profile

Caramelized hazelnut, lemon tart, round & velvety mouthfeel, long chocolate aftertaste

Facts

Origin: Guatemala

Region: Acatenango

Farm: Finca El Platanar y Anexos

Altitude: 1,600 - 1,900 m

Varietal: Catuai, Caturra

Process: Washed

Type: Single Origin

entry.title: MIEL
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastary
Type: Coffee
Price: 60.00 - 95.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

El Salvador is known for having volcanos all over the country. The landscape has benefitted them in many ways, especially with its rich volcanic soils. Finca Loma de Paja happened to be on the hills of El Salvador's tallest volcano, that is the Ilamatepec Volano also known as the “Volcan de Santa Ana” which made its last eruption in 2005. The growing land range in altitudes from 1200MASL meters to 1850MASL meters. With it is rich in volcanic soil and the ideal varietals they are able to produce some of their country’s top-quality coffee.

CYPHERED PROFILE

Chocolate, hazelnut, piquant acidity, smooth velvety mouthfeel, long sweet aftertaste

Facts

Origin: El Salvador

Region: Santa Ana, Ilamatepec Volcano

Altitude: 1,250 m

Varietal: Red Bourbon

Process: Honey

entry.title: MAGNIFICO
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 60.00 - 95.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

The Andrade Family is one of the oldest coffee-producing families in Cerrado Mineiro region, at the Minas Gerais state in Brazil. The Capim Branco Farm has deeds dating back to 1901. Nowadays, following the footsteps of their ancestors, the brothers Ismael and Eduardo Andrade are the owners, producing coffee with passion and respect for the environment and people for over a century.


In the early 90's they decided to expand production, volume Improvement, and quality all together, acquiring the São Silvestre Farm in Serra do Salitre, also part of Cerrado Mineiro - Minas Gerais state. The farm and its Terroir are situated in an altitude ranging between 1100 - 1220 meters, with perfectly balanced wet and dry seasons.

With Dolce Cerrado, we offer a blend of both Terroirs, São Silvestre and Capim Branco, delivering a coffee with all the striking features of the Cerrado Mineiro region. A much appreciated coffee for espresso extractions.

CypherED Profile

Dark chocolate, dried apricot, hazelnut, round body, honeyed sweet finish

Facts

Origin: Brazil
Region: Cerrado Mineiro
Producer: Sao Silvestre
Altitude: 1,200 m
Varietal: Yellow Catuai
Process: Pulped Natural

entry.title: UKARIMU
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 60.00 - 95.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

In 2020, after a 40+ year “pause” due to the ongoing conflict in Eastern DR Congo, The Nicolaides family is proud to present their very first Fully Washed Arabica K3 production. The Washing Station is located in South Kivu, along the shores of Lake Kivu, where they took over an abandoned site. With the support and encouragement of the local community, they commissioned the station in March and to date have purchased over 150,000 kg of Cherries.

CypherED Profile

Cherries, red apple, ripe mango, rich and syrupy, subtle acidity, sweet lingering soft spice finish

Facts

Origin: Congo

Region: South Kivu

Altitude: 1,134 m

Varietal: Bourbon

Process: Natural

entry.title: GREAT MANDAILING
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 60.00 - 95.00 (2 variants)

Aceh is well known for producing one of the most remarkable Sumatran coffees in the world. Wet-hulled “Giling Basah” is a traditional coffee processing method only done in Sumatra.

Unlike other coffees, Sumatra coffee parchments are hulled when they are still wet. Although this process creates unique characters in Sumatra coffee, it is also the main reason why the coffee is produced in limited quantities. Once it’s collected in Aceh, the coffee is then transported to Medan where it is sorted with colour sorter, gravity table and by hand, bagged and then shipped.

 

CypherED Profile

Hints of tobacco and cedar aromas with intense cacao, full-bodied with a pleasant spicy finish

Facts

Origin: Indonesia

Region: North Sumatra

Altitude: 1,200m-1,500m

Varietal: Ateng

Process: Wet Hulled

entry.title: SANTA LUCIA
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastary
Type: Coffee
Price: 60.00 - 95.00 (2 variants)

Sul de Minas is the most important coffee production center in Brazil with about 14 cities, and the region accounts on average, 30 % of Brazilian production of coffee. Among the factors that contribute to South of Minas has increased competitiveness in coffee production are the climate and soil; infrastructure of the properties; varying production systems; tradition and sustainability. The mountainous terrain is ideal for coffee production. The altitude varies from 950 to 1300 meters and the annual temperature stays around 22 to 24ºC.

FARM HISTORY

 Santa Lucia farm was bought in 1994. Since then, all the family has been working together, respecting and protecting the workers of the farm. The respect and the gratitude to the farm workers is so great that, the coffee produced there, received the name of one of them, the oldest one, Diquinho. In total, there were 62 hectares of land, used only for cattle. In 1998, the owners decided that it was time to invest in another type of agribusiness and then, began to planting coffee, dedicating 8 hectares of land to it. This number has grown and today the farm counts on 123 hectares of land, dedicating 30 hectares for coffee and has an annual average production of 1000 bags.The remaining areas are represented by native forests which were 25% recovered, since they didn't exist when the farm was bought. In 2016, the family poured its efforts into producing high quality and excellent coffees, which went on to conquer during the Cup of Excellence competition, where it won 6th place in the natural coffees category.Sweetness is the main characteristic of this coffee and it also presents interesting complexities of flavours due to the "terroir" of this small micro-region known as Serra das Abelhas.

 

cyphered profile

 Floral, Nutty, Vanilla, Chocolate Flavors, Syrupy

 

Facts

Origin: Brazil

Region:  Sul de Minas

Altitude: 900 -1020m

Varietal: Yellow Catuai

Process: Natural

entry.title: CHUBBY
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 60.00 - 95.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

La Roca is produced by 65 small-scale coffee growers that live on the Cordillera of Dipilto, a nature reserve with incredible biodiversity of flora and fauna. It is located very close to the frontier with Honduras. The region is popular because of the annual celebration of the Guadalupe Virgin that takes place there. The celebration is a feast and is named after the Virgen de la Piedra who looks over Dipilto from the sacred monument that sits on the mountain in Dipilto. This mountain or “rock” is where La Roca, gets its name from. 

Specialty coffee is what makes Dipilto such a well-known area. Conditions such as its elevation, soils, and microclimates make this community ideal for exceptional coffees. Caravela Nicaragua began to work with the small-scale growers in this area in 2012. It wasn’t until the end of 2013 however when we decided to install a cupping lab in Ocotal, allowing us to be closer to the producers to help them produce better quality coffees. “La Roca is a floral coffee with notes of brown sugar, milk chocolate, and a silky body - making an amazing combination of sweet and juicy flavors.

CypherED Profile

Dark chocolate fudge, roasted almonds, black raisins, nutmeg, creamy body, bold long finish

Facts

Origin: Nicaragua

Region: Dipilto

Altitude: 1,250 - 1,500 m

Varietal: Maragogype

Process: Washed

entry.title: TAMARA
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 60.00 - 95.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

Tamara, a small traditional town in Northern Casanare located at the foothill of the Andes on the banks of the river Pauto. Up a winding road from there is the fertile plateau of ‘El Tablon de Tamara’ (the table mountain of Tamara), here the lush vegetation features plantains, bananas and, of course, coffee!

CypherED Profile

This coffee has a medium-high body, balanced with hints of caramel, dried fruit, and a  chocolatey mouthfeel. 

Facts

Origin: Colombia

Region: Casanare - Village of Támara

Altitude: 1,400m

Varietal: Castillo

Process: Washed

Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 60.00 - 95.00 (2 variants)

Just in case you were wondering why this amazing coffee is named "1930”, that is because Arabica Coffee arrived in Burundi in the 1930s and has been the country’s primary export ever since.

 

The country has a long tradition of producing fully washed specialty coffee thanks to their infrastructure of washing stations.

 

Today, the country is home to high-quality coffee cherries and an extremely strict process where by they are first soaked in water then remove floaters. Afterwards, the cherries are spread to dry for 2 days while staff sorts out all the immature and overripe cherries. The process is then completed by drying the cherries in the sun on raised tables for a period up to 30 days depending on the availability of sun.  

 

CypherED Profile

Plum, orange peel, creamy body, toasted nuts, silky and smooth, sugar cane sweetness

Facts

Origin: Burundi

Region: Kayanza

Altitude: 1700 - 2000 m

Varietal: Bourbon, Mbirizi

Process: Washed

entry.title: BLOCK 903
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 60.00 - 95.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

The GATUKUZA Coffee Washing Station started operations in 2008 became a salvation for coffee farmers in Burundi. It became immensely popular in the region and is among the top 10 companies coffee producers in Burundi.

The Gatukuza Coffee Washing Station is located at Gatukuza village, in the Ngozi Province, and lies at 1,750m above sea level.

Since the opening of the Washing Station in 2008, the company has exported numerous containers of Arabica Green Coffee; both specialty as well as commercial grade. The Gatukuza Coffee Washing Station is a big unit with high production capacities and produces amazing coffee with high notes varying from 85 to 90 points. In fact, the station has won the BURUNDI CUP OF EXCELLENCE 2019 with 90.13 points.

The specialty coffee produced at GATUKUZA Coffee Washing Station comes from farmers from different villages surrounding the washing station range in altitudes between 1,750 m and 1,850m, and the farmers are grouped in different associations all which form a big confederation known as NKORERA NZOGUHEMBA.

     

    CypherED Profile

    Caramel, Soft Spice, Sugar Cane, rich buttery mouthfeel, smooth clean finish

    Facts

    Origin: Burundi

    Region: Ngozi Province

    Altitude: 1750 - 1850 m

    Varietal: Bourbon

    Process: Washed

entry.title: GEMS
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastary
Type: Coffee
Price: 60.00 - 95.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

Loja, located south to the Ecuadorian Andes, covers vast territories that stretch from coastal plains to the oriental

foothills of the mountain range. Its broad topography encompass a wide variety of climatic floors and ecosystems in the Andes. Among those are valleys that fall 1,200 - 2,000 meters above sea level, giving birth to unique conditions for specialty coffee.

Few places in the world combine the best climate, organic and soil conditions as Loja. Without a doubt, it is a blessed origin of specialty coffee. With the continued growth of specialty coffee production over the past 5 years, Loja has experienced a revival with 12,000 hectares of production, not only with original varietals but with popular ones from other regions like Geisha and SL28.

 

CypherED Profile

Cacao, smooth medium body and acidity, walnuts, vanilla, lingering sweet finish

Facts

Origin: Ecuador

Region: Loja Province

Altitude: 1,200 - 2,000 m

Varietal: Typica Mejorado

Process: Washed

entry.title: BONANZA
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 60.00 - 95.00 (2 variants)

Mirna Lizeth Domínguez Márquez is part of the third coffee generation in her family, her parents María Nery Márquez and Alfonso Domínguez, both coffee producers were famous for their passion and dedication and have cultivated and lived for coffee. At a very young age, Mirna got involved in the field and awakened her passion for coffee, generating expectations and inspiring her in new challenges of becoming a coffee producer that owns her own farm, faithfully believing that her dreams could be fulfilled, with a lot of effort, work and dedication. In 2018 she achieved her goal of being the owner of "Colibrí" farm as it has a lot of vegetation and attracts many types of birds that delight them with their song and their colorful plumage. Currently, she gets the pleasure visiting her farm in the company of her 11-year-old daughter, who is her inspiration to chase and develop her dreams and transmit to her the culture and passion for coffee, the countryside, and nature that are part of life.

 

CypherED Profile

Caramel fudge, hazelnut, round body, chocolate aftertaste.

Facts

Origin: Honduras

Region: Montecillos

Altitude: 1,600 m

Varietal: Lempira

Process: Washed
